On Jun 25, 2007, at 6:53 PM, Cesar G. Miguel wrote:

> Well.... I guess I found some interesting ideas from an old and long
> topic (Aug 24, 2005): "Introduction---recurrency question".
>
> But any comments on the same issue are welcome!

Hi Cesar,

Also see a few more recent threads where this was discussed at  
length.. They are entitled:

* "HyperNEAT release site change and more info" - starting 4/11/2007
* "Another note on activation" - starting 4/13/2007

I hope those threads help.  A good portion of them is me just trying  
to explain the "sorted network, single update" method; however, once  
that was understood by all, it was generally agreed that they are  
simply two different ways to activate a network.  Ken ultimately  
signaled that the NEAT way ("unsorted network, multiple updates") was  
the more common among neural network researchers.
--
Stephen Waits
steve@...
http://swaits.com/



--Apple-Mail-1-515661656
